data.title: Polyergus samurai Raid On Formica japonica Colony
data.meta_description:
Copyright © Daniel Ruyle
	
	The Polyergus samurai ant species exists as a parasite on Formica species hosts and they do no work,  After first entering a host colony and killing the queen, these social parasites raise the eggs and pupae as slaves.  When the number of slave workers declines, they embark on periodic raids to steal more larvae.
data.text:
Copyright © Daniel Ruyle

The Polyergus samurai ant species exists as a parasite on Formica species hosts and they do no work, After first entering a host colony and killing the queen, these social parasites raise the eggs and pupae as slaves. When the number of slave workers declines, they embark on periodic raids to steal more larvae.
